quote: I have used AI to create a list of restaurants. I've used AI to create grocery lists, and I have used AI, let's see, to help me with travel plans.
It recommends meal plans for the week and then the grocery lists that would help me shop.
I would like to use AI to clean up my personal email inbox, but I can't find the time or don't know the right tools to use.
I really haven't looked into any because I don't seem to find the time to pay attention to my own personal email.
The Perfect AI tools help me stay more organized, complete tasks faster, and pull information from various areas of the things I work on throughout the day.
In my personal life, I would say that keeping my emails more organized would be a huge help, and this would also benefit my professional life.

In the professional world, I often deal with a lot of different data pieces, and integrating them between the various software systems I work in would be much more efficient than having to do manual entry.
I find that keeping addresses up to date on a regular basis is very difficult to do.
finding a way to keep those updated and unsubscribing from emails that I don't utilize regularly would be helpful.

It's a little strange responding to an AI interviewer when you're not hearing the question first ... It would probably be a bit easier if there was an AI-generated face that you're talking to or a voice that you're hearing so that you can respond, and it doesn't feel so much like a one-way conversation.
I do like it better than having to type it out because I think you get a much faster response, and you can't really delete or take back what you just said.
I also get self-conscious about the number of times I say "so," and that's a little odd.
